Moved Permanently

The document has moved here.

Apache/2.0.55 (Debian) DAV/2 mod_ssl/2.0.55 OpenSSL/0.9.8a mod_perl/2.0.1 Perl/v5.8.7 Server at 10.0.1.201 Port 80
Adding "User-Agent: Microsoft Data Access Internet Publishing Provider DAV" to the request header makes the command succeed.

text:
This is a client issue which can be worked-around via the configuration.

See this section in default conf file.

#
# The following directive disables redirects on non-GET requests for
# a directory that does not include the trailing slash.  This fixes a 
# problem with Microsoft WebFolders which does not appropriately handle 
# redirects for folders with DAV methods.
# Same deal with Apple's DAV filesystem and Gnome VFS support for DAV.

BrowserMatch "Microsoft Data Access Internet Publishing Provider" \
redirect-carefully
BrowserMatch "^WebDrive" redirect-carefully
BrowserMatch "^WebDAVFS/1.[012]" redirect-carefully
BrowserMatch "^gnome-vfs" redirect-carefully
BrowserMatch "Microsoft-WebDAV-MiniRedir" redirect-carefully

creator: james.grinter@uk.nomura.com
text:
Note, as of mid-2007 (maybe earlier), this workaround for "Microsoft Data 
Access Internet Publishing Provider" has a negative impact upon other usage by 
that client (Windows XP Web Folders.)

If you enable it, XP sees 'phantom' directories, which are actually the parent 
directory. If you disable it, they go away, but XP cannot then rename 
directories.
